result.execSummary:
The defendant Kealy L Scordato was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Narcotic Drugs, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(am).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Cash bail applied to costs, paid in full. Balance refunded to poster.

Submit to an AODA assessment, follow through with any treatment, counseling.  No use or possession of alcohol or illegal drugs/drug paraphernalia. Comply with random urine screens.  Maintain absolute sobriety. No use or possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription. Valid prescriptions only with prior agent approval and to be taken only in the manner they are ordered.
Advise physicians of this conviction. Inform agent of all prescriptions. Sign releases.

06/10/16 COURT MODIFIES CONDITIONS TO ALLOW POSSESSION OF ALCOHOL FOR THE PURPOSE OF EMPLOYMENT.

Case 15CF293 was dismissed and read in. No new law violations. Provide DNA specimen unless previously obtained, surchage is imposed. Work toward employment and/or school combination. Follow through with any treatment or counseling recommended by agent. 
  If probation is revoked and a prison term is not ordered, or if probation is discharged/terminated, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collection may include income assignment.

timeConds.notes: Non-working hours. Release for standard conditions. Sentence credit of 38 days were granted. LAST 58 days are STAYED for use of agent with court's permission.

records.addlTxt: Wis. Dept. of Corrections notice of case status change received.  Outstanding financial obligations have been satisfied.
Order granting request to allow possession of alcohol for employment purposes, signed and filed.
Dated 06/06/16, from Probation Agent Staus, requesring modification of court ordered conditions. Proposed order attached.
with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

Defendant Kealy L Scordato in court, in custody, with attorney M. Elizabeth Weathers.   Lucas Paul Bennewitz appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant enters guilty plea to count # 1. Court performs plea colloquy and finds defendant guilty of count #1.  Count #2, and 15CF293 are dismissed and read in. State gives sentencing recommendations. Atty Weathers makes statements regarding sentencing. Defendant makes Statements. 

The Defendant was sentenced to the following:

COUNT#1:

IMPOSED AND STAYED SENTENCE OF:   

___ 1 YEAR JAIL, STRAIGHT TIME 

TERM OF PROBATION:  2 YEARS

CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:  ***TRANSFER ALLOWED TO MILWAUKEE COUNTY***

____Absolute Sobriety;  Random U.A.'s ; 
____No Use or Possession of alcohol or illegal drugs 
____No Use or Possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription;
____Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are 
prescribed.
____Inform Agent of all prescriptions, sign releases.
____Advise any treating Physician of this conviction
____Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent;
____Work toward employment and/or combination of schooling 
____DNA sample to be provided if not yet previously done.
____No new law violations

COSTS:  $268.00 +250.00 DNA surcharge (to be paid as a condition of probation)

CONDITION TIME: 90 days-Non-working hours with standard release conditions, credit for 32 days, last 58 days STAYED for use of agent with court permission. 

Felony warnings, voting rights and firearms warnings given.
Hearing on June 25, 2015 at 10:00 am.
Dated 05/14/15, from Atty Weathers to Judge Carter, requesting earlier date for resolution of cases.
